intro: Elionurus royleanus f. pygmaeus, commonly known as the dwarf leaved elionurus, is a unique botanical variant of the species Elionurus royleanus. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its small, compact growth habit. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers. It is native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas, where it thrives in rocky and arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
